member.name: TCP_ESTATS_DATA_ROD_v0
member.summary: The TCP_ESTATS_DATA_ROD_v0 structure contains read-only dynamic information for extended TCP statistics on data transfer for a TCP connection.

member.name: TCP_ESTATS_DATA_ROD_v0.DataBytesOut
member.summary: The number of octets of data contained in transmitted segments, including retransmitted data. Note that this does not include TCP headers.

member.name: TCP_ESTATS_DATA_ROD_v0.DataSegsOut
member.summary: The number of segments sent containing a positive length data segment.

member.name: TCP_ESTATS_DATA_ROD_v0.DataBytesIn
member.summary: The number of octets contained in received data segments, including retransmitted data. Note that this does not include TCP headers.

member.name: TCP_ESTATS_DATA_ROD_v0.DataSegsIn
member.summary: The number of segments received containing a positive length data segment.

member.name: TCP_ESTATS_DATA_ROD_v0.SegsOut
member.summary: The total number of segments sent.

member.name: TCP_ESTATS_DATA_ROD_v0.SegsIn
member.summary: The total number of segments received.

member.name: TCP_ESTATS_DATA_ROD_v0.SoftErrors
member.summary: The number of segments that fail various consistency tests during TCP input processing. Soft errors might cause the segment to be discarded but some do not. Some of these soft errors cause the generation of a TCP acknowledgment, while others are silently discarded.

member.name: TCP_ESTATS_DATA_ROD_v0.SoftErrorReason
member.summary: A value that identifies which consistency test most recently failed during TCP input processing. This object is set every time the SoftErrors member is incremented.

member.name: TCP_ESTATS_DATA_ROD_v0.SndUna
member.summary: The value of the oldest unacknowledged sequence number. Note that this member is a TCP state variable.

member.name: TCP_ESTATS_DATA_ROD_v0.SndNxt
member.summary: The next sequence number to be sent. Note that this member is not monotonic (and thus not a counter), because TCP sometimes retransmits lost data by pulling the member back to the missing data.

member.name: TCP_ESTATS_DATA_ROD_v0.SndMax
member.summary: The farthest forward (right most or largest) sequence number to be sent. Note that this will be equal to the SndNxt member except when the SndNxt member is pulled back during recovery.

member.name: TCP_ESTATS_DATA_ROD_v0.ThruBytesAcked
member.summary: The number of octets for which cumulative acknowledgments have been received. Note that this will be the sum of changes to the SndNxt member.

member.name: TCP_ESTATS_DATA_ROD_v0.RcvNxt
member.summary: The next sequence number to be received. Note that this member is not monotonic (and thus not a counter), because TCP sometimes retransmits lost data by pulling the member back to the missing data.

member.name: TCP_ESTATS_DATA_ROD_v0.ThruBytesReceived
member.summary: The number of octets for which cumulative acknowledgments have been sent. Note that this will be the sum of changes to the RcvNxt member.
